description: Dive into "Capturing Bhubaneswar: A Photographic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Bhubaneswar: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: Shri Ram Temple, located in the heart of Bhubaneswar, is a popular pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Rama, Goddess Sita, and Lord Lakshmana. The ornate facade and statues of Hindu deities make it a stunning architectural marvel that attracts tourists for both religious and aesthetic reasons. The temple is open to the public from early morning until late evening with no entry fee. Visitors can also explore other sub-temples within the complex dedicated to various gods and goddesses.

sources.snippet: Ram Mandir is a stunning temple dedicated to Lord Rama, his consort, Goddess Sita and his beloved brother, Lord Lakshmana. Other than religious reasons, the architectural beauty of the temple attracts tourists in large numbers. The spires on the temple shikharas can be spotted from various locations in the city.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

places.name: Shree Rama Temple, Bhubaneswar

reviews.text: A serene and spiritually uplifting place! The temple's architecture is captivating, featuring towering spires visible from various parts of the city. The idols of Lord Rama, Goddess Sita, and Lord Lakshmana are beautifully adorned. The evening aarti, accompanied by traditional musical instruments, creates a deeply devotional atmosphere. The well-maintained gardens offer a peaceful space for reflection. A must-visit for those seeking tranquility and spiritual enrichment in Bhubaneswar.

Shri Ram Mandir, located in Ekamra Vihar, Bhubaneswar, is a revered spiritual site housing idols of Shri Ram, Laxman, Maa Sita, and Lord Hanuman.

The temple experiences a significant influx of devotees during Rama Navami, making it a vibrant center of religious celebration.

It also features a Kalyana Mandap, where wedding ceremonies are performed with sacred rituals.

Entry to the temple is completely free of charge, making it accessible to all devotees.

Visitors can conveniently park their vehicles around the boundary of the temple premises.

The temple sees peak footfall from November to April, drawing both local worshippers and tourists.

"Its images appear under 'Ram Mandir' located in Jharapada on Google Maps, so don't get confused."

This Ram Mandir is a very beautiful temple. If you go inside this Ram Mandir in Bhubaneswar, you will find a very lovely architecture which will make your mind happy.When you see this temple, you will feel as if you are seeing a mix of both traditional and modern architecture.You will find many more idols of Gods inside this temple. You must go there and have darshan. The location of this temple is at a very prime location. It is near the station, so you must go there and have darshan.

places.address: 1, Madhusudan Marg, Ekamra Vihar, UNIT- 9, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751001, India

places.generalDescription: Nandankanan Zoological Park, located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, is a sprawling 437-hectare zoo and botanical garden established in 1960. It's home to over 1,500 animals including white tigers and pangolins. The park offers various attractions such as boating, safaris featuring white tigers, lions, bears and herbivores, a reptile park, zoo museum, orchid house and an aquarium.

sources.snippet: About 20 km away from Bhubaneswar by road, the Nandankanan Zoological Park (https://www.nandankanan.org/) is a popular attraction, especially for families with kids in tow. So to avoid long queues at the ticket counters during winter and school holidays, book online (https://www.nandankanan.org/tickets/). The Park, also home to the State Botanical Garden, is open on all days except Mondays; April to September, it is open between 7.30 am 5.30 pm while October to March, it is open from 8am to 5pm.
sources.shortName: Top Five Places To Visit In Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: At a distance of 17 km from Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Nandankanan Zoological Park is a zoo and botanical garden lies in the vicinity of Kanjia Lake in Bhubaneswar. It is one of the biggest and largest zoo parks in India and also one of the famous Bhubaneswar Tourist Places.Spread over an area of 400 hectares, Nandankanan was established in 1960 and declared as a sanctuary and zoo in 1979. It became the first zoo in India to join World Association of Zoos and Aquariums in 2009.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Located 20 kilometers away from Bhubaneswar, Nandankanan Zoological Park is a zoo set up amidst the forest of Chandaka. Established in 1960 as a bastion of white tigers the zoo was converted into a natural reserve upon the recommendation of National Geographical Magazine. Stretching over an area of 4.37 sq km, the park offers a natural habitat to the rare species of flora and fauna.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Spread across a massive area of 990 acres, the Nandankanan Zoological Park contains a zoo and a botanical park. It was inaugurated in 1979 and contains portions of the Chandaka Forests and Kanjia Lake. The Zoo contains several rare and endangered species such as White Tigers, Asiatic Lions, Crocodiles, Indian Pangolin and 34 aquariums that contains several species of fish.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Attractions In Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Located amidst lush greenery and beautiful scenery, Nandankanan Zoological Park is a one of a kind pre-wedding photography location. Couples can shoot romantic moments against exotic wildlife, peaceful lakes and lush forests. The park‚Äôs unique flora and fauna offers creative and never seen before photography opportunities.
sources.shortName: Best 7 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: The Nandankanan Zoological Park is one of the premier zoos in India, making it one of the most interesting Places to visit in Bhubaneshwar. The zoo is set in a completely natural environment, built right within a forest. The zoo offers multiple entertainment facilities like lion safari, boating and cable car.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Constructed with a goal to protect and preserve the flora and fauna of the habitat, the Nandankanan Zoological Park is a gorgeous sanctuary that is worth a visit in Bhubaneswar. Want to indulge in some wildlife photography?. See, now is your chance at making the most of your trip to Bhubaneswar.
sources.shortName: 10 Tourist Places in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Credits: Dreamodisha, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. It is one of the very first zoos opened in India. There are a total of 3004 species, including mammals, birds, reptiles and amphibians at Nandankanan Zoological Park.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: It ranks as one of the biggest botanical gardens in India, area wise. It is also known to be a famous tourist spot in the city. This zoo came into limelight when it officially became the first zoo in the country to enter the World Association of Zoos and Aquariums in 2009.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places to visit in Bhubaneswar

places.name: Nandankanan Zoological Park

reviews.text:
My recent zoo visit was both enjoyable and educational. The variety of animals was impressive, including lions, giraffes, and playful monkeys. The enclosures were clean and well-maintained, offering good views without disturbing the animals. Informative signs taught me interesting facts about each species. The staff was friendly and eager to answer questions. Overall, it was a delightful experience, perfect for families and anyone interested in wildlife.
Adventure activity like boatingüö§,zip liningüöà,Toy trainüöÜare also available.

Nandankanan is a top recommendation for anyone who loves wildlife and nature. It's not just a great spot for families, but also a standout zoo in India due to its strong focus on conservation and its beautiful natural setting. While a few small tweaks to maintenance and crowd management could make the experience even better, its unique qualities make it a must-see destination.
* Timings: The park is open from 7:30 AM to 5:30 PM from April to September and from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM from October to March. Please note, it is closed on Mondays.

Just visited Nandankanan Zoological Park recently, and honestly, I had a really good time here. The zoo is pretty big and well maintained. Loved the greenery all around ‚Äì it gives such a calm and refreshing vibe üåø

Got to see so many animals up close, especially the white tiger, which was amazing! üêØ The safari was also a great experience ‚Äì felt exciting to see animals roaming freely in that area. Definitely something different from the usual zoo experience.

It's a great spot to spend time with family or friends. There's boating too if you're into that kind of chill vibe üö£‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Overall, I'd totally recommend this place if you're in or around Bhubaneswar. Worth the visit üëç

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop the serene Dhauli Hills in Odisha, the Dhauli Shanti Stupa, also known as the Peace Pagoda, is a stunning white structure that radiates tranquility. Constructed in 1972 through a collaboration between Japanese and Indian Buddhist organizations, this remarkable shrine serves as a poignant reminder of Emperor Ashoka's transformation from a conqueror to an advocate for peace following the Kalinga War.

sources.snippet: Dhauli Shanti Stupa in Odisha stands as a symbol of peace and tranquility, perched atop Dhauli Hills overlooking the Daya River. This majestic white stupa, built in the early 1970s, commemorates the historic Kalinga War and Emperor Ashoka's transformative journey from conquest to Buddhism, promoting a message of non-violence and harmony.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Credits: Sailesh Patnaik, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. Also known as Peace Pagoda, Shanti Stupa of Dhauligiri marks the end of the great Kalinga War. When King Ashoka adopted the path of peace and took up Buddhism, he laid the foundation of the Dhauli Shanti Stupa.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: The Shanti Stupa is also called Peace Pagoda and was built by the Japan Buddha Sangh and the Kalinga Nippon Buddha Sangh in the 70s. It is situated at the top of the Dhauli Giri hill about 7 kilometres away from Bhubaneswar (on the way to Puri). Many tourists and locals frequent this place to meditate and pray.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Owning the formal name of DhauliGiri Shanti Stupa, this is a Buddhist structure, built in 1972. It is the architectural excellence of this structure that makes it one of the best Places to visit in Bhubaneshwar. The peace pagoda was built as a result of an Indo Japanese collaboration.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Dhauli Shanti Stupa

reviews.text:
Free entrance..üëçüèª

I had a beautiful experience Here you will see various posture of Lord Buddha...

places.generalDescription: Biju Patnaik Park, also known as the Forest Park, is a centrally located city park that offers expansive green spaces, well-maintained gardens, playgrounds, and trails. It has become a popular spot for locals to relax and for tourists to visit. The park features unique attractions such as a floating mountain, jogging tracks, musical fountains, play areas for children, rockeries, and rosarium.

sources.snippet: Also popular as the ‚ÄòForest park‚Äô, the Biju Patnaik Park can be found located centrally in the city, presently glorified as a relaxing spot for the locals and a sightseeing attraction for the tourists. Some of the remarkable features of the park which make it stand out for the tourists are the floating mountain, jogging tracks, musical fountains, play area for children, rosarium and rockeries, making this park an excellent getaway for the city dwellers.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Popularly known as ‚ÄòForest Park‚Äô, Biju Patnaik Park is located in the middle of the city. Fondly addressed the most beautiful parks in the city by adults and children, it is the best place to spend quality time in the early mornings and evenings. The green lawns, plants, trees, flowers, climbers, and hedges, will leave you mesmerised.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Dedicated to Biju Patnaik, the chief minister of Odisha, the Biju Patnaik Park is a recreational place preferred most as a picnic destination due to its accessibility. It has an amusement park and boating facilities amidst beautifully landscaped gardens that draw tourists, especially nature lovers, in quite a large number.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Dedicated to the former Chief Minister of the State, Biju Patnaik, the statue of the political figure can be found in the middle of the park. He was a reformer who started the BJD (Biju Janta Dal), the political body in Odisha. He won the title of ‚ÄòBhoomi Putra‚Äô- the highest Indonesian award.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places to visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Located in Berhampur, the Biju Patnaik Park is dedicated to the former chief minister of the state. The park covers an area of about 23 acres including three water bodies. It was formerly known as the ‚ÄòForest Park‚Äô owing to the wide variety of flora and fauna thriving in the area.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Relax and unwind in the company of nature after a tiresome day exploring Bhubaneshwar at the Biju Patnaik Park. The park is surrounded by lovely trees and flowers. Kids will love the play park nearby that is equipped with slides and rides.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

places.name: Biju Patnaik Park

reviews.text: I found this place quite peaceful and nice. There are many beautiful things here which will attract children a lot. This place is also very good for children to play. If you want, you can also sit here and enjoy the sunset.

A Wonderful and Peaceful Escape!
This park is truly an amazing and peaceful place! It's a perfect retreat from the hustle and bustle of city life, offering immense tranquility. The lush greenery and vibrant flowers all around create a serene atmosphere, making it an ideal spot to spend some time close to nature. If you're looking for peace and beauty, this park is an excellent choice.
A beautiful park to spend your peaceful momment with your friends, family ,and also for couples

places.generalDescription: The Odisha State Tribal Museum is a fascinating destination for those interested in the diverse tribal cultures of the region. Established in 1953 and housed in a modern building since 2001, it showcases an extensive collection of tribal costumes, jewelry, art, household objects, musical instruments and more. Visitors can explore interactive elements such as augmented reality glasses while admiring traditional dress, bead ornaments, silver collars, coin necklaces and elaborate headdresses.

sources.snippet: Credits: Balaji, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. Priorly known as the ‚ÄòMuseum of Tribal Arts and Artefacts‚Äô, the Odisha State Tribal Museum showcases the artefacts of the different tribals. By visiting this museum, you can get a clear understanding of the life of tribals, including arts, crafts, and skills, from their clothes, traditions, and jewellery to food style.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Located at the CRP Square in Bhubaneswar, the Odisha State Tribal Museum is dedicated to the 62 tribes of Odisha. It was established in 1953 as the Museum of Tribal Arts & Artefacts to represent the cultural richness of indigenous tribes. In 2001 the new building of the museum was inaugurated and it was renamed as Odisha State Tribal Museum and interests tourists seeking an insight into the tribal life in the region.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: State Tribal Museum has a splendid collection that introduces one to the 62 tribes of Odisha. Those who love to explore cultures will find the attraction a treat. The collection consists of traditional tribal costumes, jewelry, accessories, weapons and gears, farming equipment, etc.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: The Tribal Museum, located in Nayapalli, has been developed as a ‚ÄòMuseum of Man‚Äô. Open 10 am to 5pm on all days, except Mondays and government holidays, it throws light on the various tribes of Odisha and their lifestyle, art and culture.
sources.shortName: Top Five Places To Visit In Bhubaneswar

places.name: Odisha State Tribal Museum

reviews.text: A must-visit in Bhubaneswar! The Odisha State Tribal Museum beautifully showcases the diverse cultures of the tribal communities of Odisha. The life-sized tribal huts, traditional tools, clothing, and musical instruments give deep insight into their daily lives. The museum is well-maintained, with informative displays and peaceful surroundings. A perfect place for history and culture lovers. Highly recommended!

The Odisha State Tribal Museum is a must-visit for history lovers, students, and culture enthusiasts. It beautifully preserves and presents the diverse tribal heritage of Odisha. Whether you're a tourist or a local, this place offers a meaningful and enriching experience.

The Odisha Tribal Museum in Bhubaneswar is a cultural gem that beautifully showcases the rich heritage of Odisha's 62 tribal communities.
From traditional houses, weapons, musical instruments, and attire to daily lifestyle artifacts every corner reflects the vibrant essence of tribal life.

An absolute gem in the heart of Bhubaneswar! The Odisha State Tribal Museum offers a deep and fascinating glimpse into the lives, traditions, and cultures of the state's diverse tribal communities. From life size tribal hut replicas to beautifully curated galleries showcasing traditional tools, ornaments, textiles, and rituals everything is thoughtfully presented.

The museum is clean, well organized, and surprisingly peaceful. I especially appreciated the interactive exhibits and the audio visual sections that bring the tribal stories to life. The herbal garden and outdoor sculptures are a bonus if you love nature and quiet corners.

Whether you're a student, tourist, or just curious about Odisha's indigenous roots, this place is a must visit. Hats off to the efforts in preserving and celebrating such a rich cultural legacy!

places.address: CRPF Colony, Gopabandhu Nagar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751003, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled just 6 kilometers from the vibrant city of Bhubaneshwar, the Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are a treasure trove of ancient history, dating back to the 1st century BCE. These intricately carved cave dwellings served as homes for Jain ascetics and offer a unique glimpse into their simple yet profound lifestyle.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 9 km from Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Udayagiri & Khandagiri are two ancient Jain rock-cut caves located in the vicinity of Bhubaneswar. Called as twin hills caves, these caves are one of the most popular places to visit in Bhubaneswar and also one of the best places of heritage in Odisha. Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves have derived their names, owing to their location on two hills, Udayagiri and Khandagiri.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The part natural and part artificial caves were built around the 1st century BC and the subsequent years by the Chedi Dynasty. The caves contain several Jain temples and monasteries said to have been built by King Kharavela and contains a total of 33 caves. Udayagiri and Khandgiri Caves are again exemplary of some fine stone carving by the Kalinga artisans.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Attractions In Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Perhaps you recognise the tourist attraction in Bhubaneswar as Cuttack caves. These popular human-made caves are a key attraction that tourists simply cannot miss. With carved inscriptions and figures of the plenty of tribal communities who once lived in Bhubaneswar, there is a lot of historical and cultural significance that you can witness here.
sources.shortName: 10 Tourist Places in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: An ideal location for a young couple who loves history and nature to get some snaps before getting married is at Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves. These ancient caves carved out of natural rocks are famous for their sculptures, architecture and views. The caves provide a unique setting for pre-wedding photos, adding a sense of mystery and grandeur.
sources.shortName: Best 7 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Situated a few miles away from Bhubaneswar, the Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are rock cut caves believed to have been carved out by Jain monks. The caves sit adjacent to each other and have inscriptions written all over its walls. Within the two caves, there are many small caves that have important stone carvings, footprints, and sculptures.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Located 7 kilometers away from Bhubaneswar, the Khandagiri Caves are ancient artificial structures from the 2nd century BC. These rock-cut caves were built by King Kharavela of the Meghavahana dynasty. They are decorated with intricate mythological carvings and regal inscriptions and are popularly known as Cuttack Caves.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: The name of the two caves, comes mainly from their location on the hills with the respective names. Located across a road, the two caves literally stand facing each other. They are believed to have been carved out as residential accommodation for Jain monks during the reign of King Kharavela.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: The Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are archaeologically, historically, and religiously significant caves which are one of the eminent tourist sites in the city of Odisha. The majority of these caves are thought to have been used by Jain monks as living places during King Kharavela's rule.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2024

sources.snippet: Credits: Phadke09, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. One of the twin caves of Bhubaneswar is the Udayagiri Caves. With 18 existing caves, it stands tall with historically significant ancient sculptures and reliefs.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Apart from being historical wonders, these caves are scenic and tranquil. The beauty lies in the architecture of these rock-cut shelters, which brings it to this list. The detailing and the textures can make any photography enthusiast fall for the place.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Locations In Bhubaneswar For Your Next Photoshoot

sources.snippet: These caves are more than just caves, in other words, a grand treat to your eyes. They are ancient caves cut out from rocks, inspired by Jainism style of architecture. It closely represents the heritage of Odisha.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places to visit in Bhubaneswar

places.name: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves

reviews.text: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are really amazing to visit. These ancient caves are beautifully carved and have a lot of history connected to Jain monks. The stone carvings are worth seeing, and some caves also give you a glimpse of meditation cells used in old times. The view from the top is also nice and peaceful. Best time to visit is in the evening or early morning when it's not too hot.

Situated on the outskirts of a bustling city in Odisha, this ancient site is a remarkable blend of history, spirituality, and nature. Carved into solid rock, the twin hill structures hold centuries-old caves that once served as dwellings and meditation chambers for monks. These rock-cut marvels are not just architectural wonders but also sacred spaces that echo the deep roots of Jainism and its teachings in the region.

The caves are adorned with intricate carvings, inscriptions, and symbolic motifs that reflect the simplicity and discipline of monastic life. Each chamber tells a silent tale of devotion, enlightenment, and the human quest for inner peace. The cool interiors, despite the surrounding heat, offer a calming and reflective environment, inviting visitors to pause and connect with a timeless past.

The surrounding landscape adds to the charm - lush greenery, chirping birds, and panoramic views of the city from the hilltops create a perfect blend of history and natural beauty. Climbing the stone steps to explore each cave is like walking through the pages of a living history book. The serenity of the place makes it a favorite for spiritual seekers, historians, and nature lovers alike.

What truly sets this site apart is its silent endurance through the ages. It continues to inspire with its blend of art, faith, and resilience. Whether it's a quiet sunrise visit or a thoughtful exploration of the caves, the experience leaves one with a deep appreciation for Odisha's ancient legacy and the peaceful strength of its spiritual traditions.

The Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves, carved in the 1st century BCE by King Kharavela of the Mahameghavahana dynasty, served as residential and meditative retreats for Jain monks and feature the famous Hathigumpha inscription detailing the king's reign.

These caves are of immense historical and religious importance, showcasing early Jain art, rock-cut architecture, and the cultural richness of ancient Kalinga.

Today, they are preserved as heritage monuments and attract pilgrims, historians, and tourists as a symbol of Odisha's spiritual and archaeological legacy.

places.generalDescription: Ekamra Kanan Botanical Gardens is a sprawling 500-acre park located just 2 km from the city center of Bhubaneswar. It's the largest botanical garden in the city and offers a diverse range of attractions, including a rose garden, cactus collection, musical fountain, and a picturesque lake where visitors can enjoy paddle boating.

sources.snippet: Ekamra Kanan covers a vast expanse of over 500 acres and is the biggest Botanical Garden in the city. The beautiful landscape of the garden is a treat to the nature lovers who can spend hours strolling across the lawns, sit by the flower beds or get mesmerized by the serene waters of the lake.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Over 512 acres, Ekamra Kanan Botanical Gardens is a beautiful place. This botanical garden has been successful in presenting a huge stretch of nature in front of people and photographers. Several exotic flora species in the garden make it an ideal place for a pre-wedding photo shoot.
sources.shortName: Best 7 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Bhubaneswar

places.name: Ekamra Kanan Botanical Gardens

reviews.text: Best place to hangout with friends. Kids can have their time of play. Really clean garden. Koraput coffee available inside. You can spot peacock if you are lucky enough. Charges 20 for bike and 40 for entry.

A beautifully maintained park. Exclusively for those who don't mind paying a premium for fresh air.

Entry? Just 40 bucks. Want to park your bike? That's another 20. Got a car? That'll be 40. Because nature is best enjoyed with a price tag.

Truly a paradise ‚Ä¶ if your idea of a park includes a receipt.

One of the best parks in Bhubaneswar, this spacious park has recently undergone several upgrades, especially in the children's play area. It now features multiple slides and swings, making it a great spot for kids. A water fountain has also been added, which typically starts operating after 4:00 PM.

Another highlight is the newly inaugurated Cactus House, opened by the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Odisha, Shri Mohan Charan Majhi.

The park has an entry fee, which likely helps in maintaining a peaceful and less crowded environment. Inside the park, you'll also find a Koraput Coffee outlet that offers coffee, millet cookies, and millet cake at reasonable prices.

Entry Fees:

Car Parking: ‚Çπ40

Adults: ‚Çπ40

Children: ‚Çπ15

places.address: Government of Orissa, Forests and Environment Department, Nayapalli, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751015, India

places.generalDescription: The Regional Museum of Natural History is a museum dedicated to the conservation and display of natural history specimens from across the region. The collection encompasses both scientific collections and artefacts representative of local cultures and traditions. The museum is open to the public on weekdays from 9am to 5pm, and admission is free. Highlights of the collection include exhibits on geology, botany, zoology, archaeology and ethnography.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 5 km from Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Regional Museum of Natural History is a famous museum located near Acharaya Vihar Square on Sachivalaya Marg, Bhubaneswar. Because of its huge collection, this museum is considered as the third best Regional Museum of Natural History in India and also one of the best Tourist Places in Bhubaneswar.The Regional Museum of Natural History in Bhubaneswar was established in the year 2004 under the Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India. The main motive behind the establishment of the museum is to create awareness about the environment and promoting conservation education among the general public and students.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Regional Museum of Natural History has an impressive collection of plants, skeletons of rare and extinct animals, photographs and relevant samples from all over the world and information on the geology of the city. Established by the Ministry of Environment and Forest, this is the only museum in India that has, on display, a rare egg of the now extinct Elephant Bird, the Baleen Whale and many more (Read More) such exhibits that help enlighten the knowledge of animal and nature lovers.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Credits: Ramjit Tudu, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. We don‚Äôt want you to miss out on this museum since it exhibits the rich botany, zoology, and geology of Odisha. The Regional Museum of Natural History aims to create environmental awareness for visiting students by having experiential resource centres such as the ‚ÄòDiscovery Room‚Äô, ‚ÄòActivity Room‚Äô, etc.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Regional Museum of Natural History was established in 2004 under the aegis of the Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India. It was laid down to impart non-formal environmental education and generate awareness about the conservation of natural resources. Being one of its kind among the museums in Eastern India it boasts of unique and rare natural exhibits.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: One of the must visit attractions in Bhubaneshwar is the regional museum of natural history. It is a collection of multiple exhibits that display the huge number of plants and animals from around the region. Tourists must visit the special taxidermy gallery in the museum where they can find displays of animals such as cheetah, Hyena, Deer and much more.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Regional Museum of Natural History

reviews.text:
Visiting the Regional Museum of Natural History, Bhubaneswar was a great experience! The museum is well-organized and has amazing displays about nature, wildlife, and tribal life. One of the best parts is the life-size animal models, which make you feel like you're in a real jungle.

The museum has sections on different animals, birds, marine life, and even fossils. Seeing dinosaur fossils up close was really exciting! The tribal section teaches about how local communities live in harmony with nature. Everything is presented in a simple and interesting way, so both kids and adults can enjoy it.

What I loved the most was how interactive and educational the museum is. There are plenty of things to learn, and it's a great place for school trips and families. Plus, the best part-it's completely free! The museum is well-maintained, and the staff is friendly.

If you are in Bhubaneswar and love nature or wildlife, this place is a must-visit. It's a peaceful and informative place where you can spend a couple of hours exploring and learning. Highly recommended for nature lovers, students, and anyone curious about the world around us!

I really enjoyed my visit to the Regional Museum of Natural History. The exhibits are not only informative but also beautifully arranged. I was especially impressed by the fossil section and the life-size animal models - they truly bring nature to life. It's a peaceful and inspiring place, perfect for a weekend visit with family or friends. Highly recommended.
Absolute delight to tour this museum. There are so many things for a curious mind in this museum. Definitely a must visit place if you are planning a vacation in Bhubaneswar

places.address: Sachivalaya Marg, near Planetorium, Doordarshan Colony, Acharya Vihar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751013, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bhubaneswar, ISKCON Bhubaneswar is a captivating Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. Established in 1991 by the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, this spiritual haven serves as an alternative pilgrimage site for those unable to visit the renowned Jagannath Temple in Puri. The temple boasts stunning architecture and features a lotus-shaped shrine surrounded by lush gardens that enhance its serene atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Built by the ISKCON (International Society for Krishna Consciousness) in 1991, this temple serves as an alternative to Lord Jagannath temple of Puri as that temple is restricted to Indians.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

places.name: ISKCON Temple, Bhubaneswar

reviews.text: ISKCON Temple gives us very good knowledge of spirituality all over the world. We always go to the small temple in ISKCON Temple to worship Lord Krishna.We always go to ISKCON Temple to get peace. We worship Lord Krishna in ISKCON Temple. Which temples are there in many places in India Which temples have their own beauty in each place

ISKCON Temple, Bhubaneswar - a peaceful place for devotion and reflection. It's located near NH-16, which makes it easy to reach, but the constant noise of vehicles sometimes breaks the calm. If the temple were a little away from the road, it could offer even deeper peace. Still, it's a beautiful space to feel spiritually connected.

Although I'm from BBSR, I had never been to ISKCON. For the first time, I went there with my mom on the day of Kartik Purnima. It was very crowded that day, but we were still able to get a good darshan of  bagwan.The idols of the deities are so captivating and beautiful. Lord Jagannath looked so divine that day, I didn't feel like leaving. The temple has idols of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, Subhadra, and also Radha-Krishna, all of which are extremely beautiful, enchanting, and charming.There is such a positive vibe there. After entering the temple, you feel a deep sense of peace. Seeing the deities brings tears to your eyes-nothing compares to it. And that day, they were also distributing prasad. The prasad is served there.What I loved the most inside the temple was the idols of the deities-their decorations, their attire, and the positive vibes-they were truly wonderful. The temple is shaped like a lotus flower. Prasad is available outside the temple and can also be purchased inside. Overall, it was a very beautiful experience. A must-visit place."

places.address: NH-16, near Krishna Plaza, IRC Village, Nayapalli, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751015, India

places.generalDescription: The Brahmeswara Temple, constructed in the 9th century under King Udyotakesari of the Somvasi dynasty, is a renowned Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Its elegant Kalinga-style architecture and ornate carvings make it a popular attraction for tourists and historians. The temple complex consists of a main shrine surrounded by four similar shrines, with doorways adorned with intricately carved figures and depictions of the nine planets in Indian astrology.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 3 km from Lingaraja Temple and 5 km from Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Brahmeswara Temple is a famous Hindu temple located in the temple city of Bhubaneswar. It is one of the holy places to visit in Bhubaneswar and among the best places of heritage in Orissa.Dedicated to Lord Shiva, Brahmeswara Temple stands in a courtyard flanked by four smaller temples. The temple belongs to late 11th century according to an inscription carried to Calcutta from Bhubaneswar.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The Brahmeswara Temple was built in the 9th century under the aegis of King Udyotakesari of the Somvasi dynasty. It is a famous Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva and is thronged by Hindu pilgrims and followers of the Tantric way of worship from across the country. The elegant architecture of this revered temple makes it popular among tourists and historians.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

Built-in the traditional Kalinga style of architecture, Brameswara Temple is known for its artistic sculptures. You can spot the carvings of birds, animals, and deities on the temple's exterior walls.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

places.name: Brahmeswara Temple

reviews.text: This is one if the most elaboratedly done temple in Bhubaneshwara. It has one main Shiva temple and four other small temples around it. The main temple has very breathtakingly beautiful carvings, which are mostly in good condition. As its a bit far from city center, many tourist do not come here, but you should not miss it.

The Brahmeswar Temple in Bhubaneswar is a masterpiece of Kalinga architecture, standing as a testament to Odisha's rich heritage. Built in 1058 CE by Kolavati Devi, the mother of Somavamsi king Udyotakesari, this temple marks an important transition in temple design, showcasing intricate craftsmanship and artistic excellence.

Carved out of sandstone, the temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and features breathtaking sculptures of celestial dancers, musicians, and mythological figures. The introduction of iron beams in construction and the first use of surasundaris (heavenly maidens) on temple walls make it a significant milestone in temple architecture.

Surrounded by smaller shrines, Brahmeswar Temple's sanctum enshrines a powerful Shiva Lingam, drawing devotees and history lovers alike. The temple's rekha deul (curvilinear spire) and the exquisite nagara-style carvings tell stories of devotion, art, and cultural grandeur. Even after nearly a thousand years, it remains a serene and spiritual landmark in Bhubaneswar, the City of Temples.

It's a very beautiful temple dedicated to Lord Shiva and built in 1058 (around 1000 years old).
It's architecture is awesome. It's open for public and there is no ticket or entry fee.

places.address: Near, Tankapani Rd, Siba Nagar, Brahmeswarpatna, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751002, India

places.generalDescription: Dhauli Hills, located in Bhubaneswar, is a popular tourist destination known for its breathtaking panoramic views of the city and surrounding countryside. The hills offer a challenging yet rewarding trekking experience with steep slopes leading to the top. This historical site is home to the Shanti Stupa, built by Japanese people as a symbol of peace and tranquility. Visitors can explore rock edicts of Emperor Ashoka, reflecting the area's rich heritage and spiritual significance.

sources.snippet: Located at the banks of the Daya River, the Dhauli hill is considered to be the place where the ancient Kalinga war took place. The edicts of Ashoka describing the ancient war can also be found here along with a rock-cut elephant. After the Kalinga war, King Ashoka was moved by the bloodshed and adopted the teachings of Buddhism and non-violence.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Attractions In Bhubaneswar

places.name: Dhauli Hills

reviews.text: Dhauli Hills is a truly peaceful and historic place that leaves a lasting impression. The Shanti Stupa is architecturally stunning with its clean lines, golden lion statues, and intricate carvings. Great spot for both tourists and locals!

A peaceful and scenic place to visit with family and kids! The view from the top is beautiful, and the Shanti Stupa adds a calm, spiritual vibe. It's a great spot to relax, click photos, and enjoy some quiet time. Kids loved the open space and the elephant statues too!

Dhauli Giri Hills in Bhubaneswar is a serene destination steeped in history and spirituality. The Shanti Stupa atop the hill offers panoramic views and a peaceful atmosphere. Visitors can also explore Ashokan Rock Edicts and the Bhaskareswar Temple nearby. The evening Light & Sound Show narrates Emperor Ashoka's transformation, enhancing the experience. Accessible from the city center, it's an ideal spot for history enthusiasts and those seeking tranquility

places.address: 5RRQ+WRQ, Dhauli Rd, Uttara, Dhauli, Odisha 752104, India

places.generalDescription: Kharavela Park, located in the Khandagiri suburb of Bhubaneswar, is a picturesque park adorned with lush green trees and well-maintained lawns. It offers visitors a jogging track, seating areas, and a dedicated play area for children. The park is popular among both adults and children for its serene pathways and beautiful surroundings. With no entry fees, it's an ideal spot for families to enjoy a day out amidst nature.

sources.snippet: The parks in Bhubaneswar have one thing in common- they are all well-maintained and have beautiful lawns. Adding to the list is- Kharavela Park. With beautiful pathways, jogging tracks and a seating area, it is loved by both adults and children.

sources.snippet: Kharavela Park is situated in the Khandagiri suburb of Bhubaneswar and is replete with shady green trees. The park also boasts of well-maintained green carpeted lawns, jogging track, benches and a separate play area for kids.

places.name: Kharavela Park

reviews.text: This park is a hidden gem for anyone looking for a peaceful escape. It has plenty of open spaces. Unlike other parks, it's never too crowded, which makes it perfect for a quiet walk or a relaxing afternoon with a book. Highly recommend this park if you're looking  for a spot away from city life! üíï

I did not like this park that much. I did not like the cleanliness here either. We saw a lot of leaves lying around. The rest of them were jogging tracks. They also seemed very small. I could see only two people walking together. There is a good arrangement of water here and there is also a place for children to play. There is also a good parking facility.
Park have multiple activities inside. Kids play area. Ample green carpet/lawn areas. Available Open gym, badminton court, Covered Yoga place, long jogging track and many more.

places.generalDescription: Bhaskareswara Temple, located near Brahmeswara Temple on Tankapani Road in Bhubaneswar, is an ancient and historically significant temple. Built by the Ganga kings during the 12th to 14th century CE, it stands out with its unique architecture resembling a Buddhist Stupa. The temple houses a remarkable 9-foot-tall Shiva Linga and is surrounded by a well-maintained park, offering visitors a peaceful and historically rich experience.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 1 km from Rajarani Temple and 5.5 km from Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Bhaskareswara Temple is an ancient temple situated near Brahmeswara Temple on Tankapani Road in Bhubaneswar. It is one of the oldest temples in Odisha and also one of the heritage places to visit in Bhubaneswar.The temple was built by Gangas during 13th - 14th century CE. This temple is quite different from the other temples of Bhubaneswar in terms of its architecture.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Bhaskareswara Temple is located towards the east of the old city, around 1 kilometer away from the Rajarani Temple. It was built by Ganga kings in the 12th century and has an attractive and unique architecture similar to that of a Buddhist Stupa. The ancient temple enshrines a 9 feet tall and 12 feet wide Shiva Linga.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the ancient temple of Bhaskareswara is located right here in the city!. Interestingly, the temple actually draws its architectural inspiration from Indian as well as Buddhist cultures. For those who do not know, the temple was actually built following the demolishing of a Buddhist stupa.

sources.snippet: Bhaskareswara Temple is a 7th century ancient Shiva Temple with a nine feet tall Shivalinga. A unique feature of the temple, apart from the size of the Shivalinga, is the architecture of the shrine that resembles a Buddhist Stupa. places.name: Bhaskareswara Temple

reviews.text:
Old ancient temple of shiva. The linga is increasing automatically year after year.
Historical Significance & Architecture

Bhaskareswar Temple is an ancient Shiva temple known for its unique architectural style and historical importance. Built during the 7th‚Äì8th century AD, the temple reflects the Kalinga style of architecture, characterized by intricate carvings and a towering structure. One of its most fascinating aspects is the presence of a massive Shiva Lingam, which is among the tallest in India. The lingam is believed to have mythological and spiritual significance, attracting devotees and history enthusiasts alike.

Religious & Spiritual Experience

The temple offers a peaceful and spiritual atmosphere, making it a great place for meditation and worship. Devotees visit throughout the year, with special crowds during Mahashivratri and Shravan Maas. The temple rituals and aarti create a divine aura, adding to the overall experience. Unlike many crowded temples, Bhaskareswar provides a serene space for deep spiritual connection.

Surroundings & Accessibility

Located in Bhubaneswar, the temple is easily accessible by road and public transport. It is surrounded by other historical temples, making it an excellent stop for those exploring the ancient heritage of the city. The temple complex is well-maintained, though some areas could benefit from better preservation efforts.

Final Verdict

Bhaskareswar Temple is a hidden gem for history lovers, devotees, and architecture enthusiasts. Its towering Shiva Lingam and tranquil setting make it a must-visit in Bhubaneswar. Whether you're seeking spiritual peace or a glimpse into Odisha's rich history, this temple is worth exploring.

Only two tier temple in Bhubaneswar due to it's peculiar 9ft long Lingam situated in it's Vimana. A must visit during Golden hours to enjoy the beautiful garden rising the serenity to a different level. Do check my ig-atul_something as i have covered all the ancient temples of Bhubaneswar there & made sort of a catalogue.

Bhaskareswara is one of the finest temple in Bhubaneswara. Its very near to Rajarani temple. The temple is huge and so is the premises. Though the temple is in almost good condition, it needs some maintenance. The surrounding garden and lawn is properly done, do locals use it as a hanging spot. You csn give it a quick visit while here.

places.generalDescription: The 64 Yogini Temple, also known as Chausath Yogini Temple, is a unique circular temple dating back to the 9th century. Situated near the Bhargavi River in Hirapur, it is one of the four Chausath Yogini Temples in the country. Built during the Kalachuri kingdom, this historical site resembles the architecture of Khajuraho.

sources.snippet: Located about 15km away by road from Bhubaneswar, the 64 Yogini Temple dates back to the early ninth century. The architecture of this temple is rather different from the popular Kalinga school of architecture. Carved into the inner wall of the circular temple are 64 niches; all except one contain a richly sculpted image of a Yogini (goddess) each.
sources.shortName: Top Five Places To Visit In Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: One of the four Chausath Yogini Temples in the country, the temple at Hirapur is situated on the bank of Bhargavi River. The only active temple of its kind, it is one of the prominent tourist places to visit in Bhubaneswar. Built-in the 9th century by Queen Hiradevi of the Bhauma dynasty the temple is also known as the Mahamaya Temple.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: At a distance of 10 km from Bhubaneswar Railway Station, Chausath Yogini Temple is a Hindu temple situated at Hirapur, Bhubaneswar. Of the four Chausath Yogini temples surviving in India, the Hirapur temple is the only active one. Situated on the bans of Bhargavi River, it is one of the famous places to visit near Bhubaneswar.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Credits: Ssriram mt, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. Also known as Mahamaya Temple, Chausath Yogini Temple, is located near the charming River Narmada. Built between the 8th and 9th centuries AD, the temple is dedicated to the yoginis, the auspicious goddess-like figures.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Considered to be built by Queen Hiradeyi, the Chausath Yogini Temple is also known as Mahamaya Temple. It is situated at a distance of 20 km from the city centre of Bhubaneswar in Hirapur. The well-known temple is dedicated to the worship of yoginis and well-known as a tantric shrine.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Located near the mesmerising River Narmada, Chausath Yogini Temple is a 10th century ancient temple that resembles the temple in Khajuraho. It was built during the Kalachuri Kingdom. The presiding deity is Goddess Durga.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

places.name: Chausathi Yogini Temple

reviews.text: The Chausathi Yogini Temple is a breathtaking historical gem that truly leaves a lasting impression. Nestled amidst serene surroundings, the temple showcases extraordinary architectural brilliance with its circular design and intricate carvings. Each of the 64 Yogini idols reflects exquisite craftsmanship and evokes a sense of spiritual tranquility. The panoramic views from the temple are mesmerizing, adding to its charm and making it a must-visit destination. A perfect blend of history, spirituality, and beauty, this temple is a treasure for heritage lovers and travelers alike!

The 36 Yogini Temple in Hirapur, located about 15 km from Bhubaneswar, is a unique and serene heritage site known for its circular, open-air structure and tantric significance. Built in the 9th century, the temple originally housed 64 Yogini idols, though only around 36 remain today, giving it its popular name. The intricate stone carvings, peaceful surroundings, and spiritual aura make it a fascinating spot for history enthusiasts and those seeking quiet reflection. Though not grand in size, the temple's distinct architecture and mystical charm leave a lasting impression. However, facilities around the site are minimal, so it's best visited as part of a short, well-planned heritage outing.

One of the oldest goddess  shrines of odisha built around 10th Century CE. Here you will find the great goddess Mahamaya's presence surrounded by 64 yoginis( Her sevikas). The environment and atmosphere was quite and serene. Must visit during spring or winter season.
